p:
The cancer cell lines used in the study i.e. HeLa (cervical cell line), HCT-15 (colorectal adenocarcinoma) and U87-MG (human glioblastoma), were procured from National Cell Center, Pune, India. The cell lines were cultured as discussed previously
40 . The anti-proliferative activity of chloroformic fungal extract was determined using 3-(4,5-dimethylthiazol-2-yl)-2,5-diphenyl tetrazolium bromide (MTT) assay
41 . To perform the MTT assay, 100 µl of the cell suspension of different cell lines, having 4 × 10 5cells/ml was dispensed in each well of the 96-well plate and incubated in CO 2 incubator at 37 °C. After 24 h, 100 µl of different concentrations of the chloroformic fungal extract were added to the wells and again incubated for 24 h. After incubation the supernatant was discarded and 100 µl of MTT was added to the wells and incubated further for 4 h. The wells were then decanted and 100 µl of dimethyl sulfoxide was added to each well. The absorbance was taken at 570 nm on the micro plate reader. The percentage of proliferation of cells was determined according to the formula given below:
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$ {\text{Percentage}}\;{\text{of}}\;{\text{proliferation}} = \left( {{\text{Absorbance}}\;{\text{of}}\;{\text{treated}}\;{\text{wells}}/\;{\text{Absorbance}}\;{\text{of}}\;{\text{control}}\;{\text{wells}}\; \times \;{1}00} \right) $$\end{document}
Percentage
of
proliferation =
Absorbance
of
treated
wells /
Absorbance
of
control
wells
×
100
